Package hac

Class ApiController

java.lang.Object
hac.ApiController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/api") public class ApiController extends Object

ApiController

This controller is handle with all the api's requests.
Available requests:
  • /api/purchase: There are 2 available methods:
    • post - Receives purchase object (firstName - string with 0 < length <=30, lastName - string with 0 < length <=30, and email - string with 0 < length <=30) and a set of ids that the user is updated with (id is a string in this case). The json should look like that {purchase:{firstName:___, lastName:___, email:___} ids:[<id1;>, <id2>,....]}. If there is an error - the cart is empty/ the ids are not the same as in the cart, return HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST error description.
    • get - Return all of the purchases in the data base.
  • /api/cart: There are multiple available methods:
    • post - receives tmdb item with the parameters: id, date, name, posterPath, popularity,and overview when id - required,and date- in yyyy-mm-dd format if exists. Returns ResponseEntity.ok(newItem). If id or date are invalid, return HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST with the relevant errors.
    • get- return all the cart's items (A map when the key is the item's id and the value is the item itself).
    • delete - delete all the cart. Could throw HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if the cart is already empty.
  • /api/cart/counter : A get request that returns the number of items in the cart.
  • /api/cart/item/{id} : A delete request that delete the wanted item's id. Throw HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if the item is not exists.
Since:
2023-05-31

  • Method Details

    • showPurchases

      @GetMapping("/purchase") public List<Purchase> showPurchases()

    • addPurchase

      @PostMapping("/purchase") public Purchase addPurchase(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid PurchaseRequest purchaseRequest)
      Receives purchase object (firstName - string with 0 < length <=30, lastName - string with 0 < length <=30, and email - string with 0 < length <=30) and a set of ids that the user is updated with (id is a string in this case).The json should look like that {purchase:{firstName:___, lastName:___, email:___} ids:[<id1;>, <id2>,....]}. If there is an error - the cart is empty/ the ids are not the same as in the cart, return HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST error description.
      Parameters:
      purchaseRequest - As described.
      Returns:
      The saved purchase.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - If the ids are not match to those in the cart or if the cart is empty.
      jakarta.validation.ConstraintViolationException - or MethodArgumentNotValidException if the purchase element is not valid.

    • addNewItem

      @PostMapping("/cart") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<TmdbItem> addNewItem(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid TmdbItem newItem)
      Receives tmdb item with the parameters: id, date, name, posterPath, popularity,and overview when id - required, and date - in yyyy-mm-dd format if exists.Returns ResponseEntity.ok(newItem). If id or date are invalid, return HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST with the relevant errors.
      Parameters:
      newItem - A json look like that: {id:___, date:___,...} (with all the parameters).
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity.ok(newItem);
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - if the item is already in the cart.

    • deleteItem

      @DeleteMapping("/cart/item/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<org.springframework.http.HttpStatus> deleteItem(@PathVariable("id") String id)
      A delete request that delete the wanted item's id. Throw HttpStatus.BAD_REQUEST if the item is not existed.
      Parameters:
      id - The wanted item's id to delete.
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity<HttpStatus> with ok status.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - if the item is not existed.

      Returns:
      ResponseEntity<HttpStatus> with ok status.
      Throws:
      org.springframework.web.server.ResponseStatusException - If the cart is already empty.
